p.s: I am writing this letter to you in the year 2050.
I am now 36 years old, but I still remember your speech 29 years ago, in the year 2021.
You were right, the leaders of the COP26 conference in 2021 were responsible for the future of the billions more of the unborn.
And yes, you were right, their anger will be all the greater if we fail.
And yes, I am worried about the future of my children and grandchildren and their grandchildren.
And there is absolute reason to.
If you, the leaders of the COP26 conference had failed, I would be more than angry.
Because it is my future.
And it not only affects the generations to come, but we can already feel the effects of climate change - then and now.
Heat records, year after year beeingbeing washed away, hurricanes, floods - even here in Germany.
I applaud your optimism because in my opinion, it is very hard to look forward if the world looks like it looked back then.
But optimism is the only thing that can help us in this time of crisis.
LoosingLosing hope means giving up.
Giving up on the future, on my future.
That means moral licensing and selfishness.
We can not give up.
If we even have the slightest hope, that we can actually chancechange something, we can overcome any crisis.
No matter how insurmountable it seems.
So you were right about keeping an optimistic view.
It was right of you to consider the consequences that the failing of COP26 may have.
The only thing I do not quite agree with, is your aproachapproach on how to stop global warming.
Frankly, I think you were talking quite generally when you said that we have the technology or We have the bankers.
What you should have said, were concrete measures and restrictions, we have to implement to stop global warming.
Tax carbon for example or force the industry to become more sustainable.
You could have also made an appeal to the people watching, not only to the politicians.
You should have encouraged us all to demand change and be optimistic, to demand our right ono a better future.
If you had done all that, maybe the present and future would look a bit less terrifying.
